output_list.reason: The mintToken function does not check for overflow, allowing the total supply to be set to any arbitrary value, granting the owner arbitrary token creation capability.
The transfer function does not check if the target address is a contract, allowing token transfers to unintentionally execute arbitrary code in the case where the recipient is a smart contract.
The transferFrom function does not check if the target address is a contract, allowing token transfers to unintentionally execute arbitrary code in the case where the recipient is a smart contract.
The buy function does not check for overflow, allowing users to buy tokens at a rate set by the owner, potentially causing a buy rate manipulation attack.
The mintToken function allows the owner to create arbitrary amounts of tokens, causing a drastic decrease in token value.
